citation.article-title: Halorhabdus tiamatea sp. nov., a non-pigmented, extremely halophilic archaeon from a deep-sea, hypersaline anoxic basin of the Red Sea, and emended description of the genus Halorhabdus.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Emended description of the genus Halorhabdus
The main characteristics of the genus Halorhabdus are as previously described (Wainø et al., 2000).
In addition, strains of some species are non-flagellated, non-motile, produce non-pigmented colonies and show a clear preference for anaerobic conditions.
The DNA G+C content ranges from 61.7 to 64.0 mol%.
The type species of the genus is Halorhabdus utahensis.
